bio.p: Dr. Gasser is a Professor of Neurology and the Director of the Department of Neurodegenerative Diseases at the Hertie-Institute for Clinical Brain Research at the University of Tübingen, and coordinator of clinical studies of the Tübingen site of the German Center for Neurodegenerative Diseases. He discovered SGCE mutations as a cause for myoclonus-dystonia syndrome and LRRK2 mutations in Parkinson’s disease. He has received the Dingebauer-Award of the German Neurologic Society and the Zülch-Prize of the Max-Planck Society. He has authored more than 400 papers.
